examples.sentence: か is almost always included in polite writing
Casual: Often omit か, use intonation
Choice Questions - Using か for alternatives
かどうか pattern - Whether or not
Question intonation - Rising pitch in questions

sections.heading: What is か (ka)?
sections.content:
か (ka) is the primary question particle in Japanese. It marks a sentence as a question and is roughly equivalent to a question mark, though question marks are also used in writing.

これは本です "This is a book" (statement) これは本ですか？ "Is this a book?" (question)

children.heading: With です/ます (Polite)
children.content:
Always use か in polite/formal situations:

学生ですか？ "Are you a student?" 行きますか？ "Will you go?" わかりますか？ "Do you understand?" 美味しいですか？ "Is it delicious?"

children.heading: Question Mark Usage
children.content:
In modern Japanese, both か and ？ are often used:

Standard: 学生ですか？ Common: 学生ですか Also seen: 学生ですか。 All three are acceptable in writing.

children.heading: 1. Polite/Formal Speech
children.content:
Always use か with です/ます forms:

これは何ですか？ "What is this?" どこに行きますか？ "Where are you going?" いくらですか？ "How much is it?"

children.heading: 2. Yes/No Questions
children.content: 日本人ですか？ "Are you Japanese?" 好きですか？ "Do you like it?" 明日来ますか？ "Will you come tomorrow?"

children.heading: 3. Information Questions
children.content:
With question words (何、誰、いつ、どこ、etc.):

これは何ですか？ "What is this?" 誰が来ますか？ "Who is coming?" いつ行きますか？ "When will you go?"

children.heading: 4. Alternative Questions
children.content:
Between choices:

コーヒーか紅茶ですか？ "Coffee or tea?" 行くか行かないか？ "Going or not going?"

children.heading: 1. Casual Conversation (だ form)
children.content:
In casual speech with だ, omit か and use rising intonation:

Casual: 学生？ (rising intonation) Not: 学生だか？ ❌ Polite: 学生ですか？ ✓ Casual: これ何？ Not: これ何だか？ ❌ Polite: これは何ですか？ ✓

children.heading: 2. With Question Words in Casual Speech
children.content: Casual: 誰？ Polite: 誰ですか？ Casual: どこ行く？ Polite: どこに行きますか？ Casual: いつ？ Polite: いつですか？

children.heading: 3. After の in Casual Questions
children.content:
の acts as a question marker itself:

Casual: 行くの？ Not: 行くのか？ (sounds masculine/rough) Polite: 行くのですか？ ✓ Casual: 何してるの？ Polite: 何をしているのですか？

children.heading: 4. With か Already Used
children.content:
Don't double up:

Wrong: 何ですかか？ ❌ Right: 何ですか？ ✓

children.heading: かどうか (ka dou ka) - "Whether or not"
children.content:
Used in indirect questions:

行くかどうかわかりません "I don't know whether (I'll) go or not" 本当かどうか確認してください "Please confirm whether it's true or not" できるかどうか試してみます "I'll try to see whether I can do it" 彼が来るかどうか聞いてください "Please ask whether he's coming"

children.heading: か (embedded questions)
children.content:
In indirect questions within sentences:

誰が来るか知っていますか？ "Do you know who is coming?" 何時に始まるか教えてください "Please tell me what time it starts" どこにあるかわかりません "I don't know where it is" いくらかかるか計算しています "I'm calculating how much it will cost"

children.heading: か with Counters
children.content:
For "about/approximately":

3つか4つ "About 3 or 4" 10分か15分 "About 10 or 15 minutes" 2、3日か "About 2 or 3 days"

children.heading: 〜か〜か (repetitive か)
children.content:
Listing alternatives or examples:

誰か "Someone" 何か "Something" どこか "Somewhere" いつか "Someday" どちらか "Either one"

children.heading: 〜か〜ないか (affirmative or negative)
children.content: 行くか行かないか "Whether to go or not" 食べるか食べないか "Whether to eat or not" 好きか嫌いか "Whether you like it or hate it"

children.heading: Formal Business/Written
children.content: ご確認いただけますでしょうか？ "Could you please confirm?" よろしいでしょうか？ "Would that be alright?" お時間はございますでしょうか？ "Do you have time?"

children.heading: Standard Polite
children.content: わかりますか？ "Do you understand?" 行きますか？ "Will you go?" いいですか？ "Is it okay?"

children.heading: Casual (omit か)
children.content: わかる？ "Understand?" 行く？ "Going?" いい？ "Okay?"

children.heading: Masculine/Rough (のか、んか)
children.content:
何してんのか？ "What are you doing?" (rough) どこ行くんか？ "Where are you going?" (dialect/rough)

These forms should be avoided by learners unless you understand the context well.

children.heading: Example 1: Meeting Someone
children.content: A: 日本人ですか？ "Are you Japanese?" B: いいえ、アメリカ人です "No, I'm American" A: 学生ですか？ "Are you a student?" B: はい、そうです "Yes, that's right"

children.heading: Example 2: Shopping
children.content: A: これはいくらですか？ "How much is this?" B: 1000円です "It's 1000 yen" A: 高いですか？ "Is it expensive?" B: いいえ、安いですよ "No, it's cheap"

children.heading: Example 3: Making Plans (Casual)
children.content: A: 明日暇？ "Free tomorrow?" B: うん、暇だよ "Yeah, I'm free" A: 映画見に行かない？ "Want to go see a movie?" B: いいね！何時？ "Sounds good! What time?"

children.heading: With Verbs
children.content: 食べますか？ "Will you eat?" 行きましたか？ "Did you go?" 見ていますか？ "Are you watching?" できますか？ "Can you do it?"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content:
い-adjectives:

美味しいですか？ "Is it delicious?" 大きいですか？ "Is it big?" 高いですか？ "Is it expensive?"

な-adjectives:

元気ですか？ "Are you well?" 便利ですか？ "Is it convenient?" 好きですか？ "Do you like it?"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: 学生ですか？ "Are you a student?" 日本人ですか？ "Are you Japanese?" 先生ですか？ "Are you a teacher?"

children.heading: Embedded in Statements
children.content: 誰が来るかわかりません "I don't know who is coming" 何時に始まるか教えてください "Please tell me what time it starts" どこに行くか決めましょう "Let's decide where to go" いつ終わるか聞いてみます "I'll try asking when it ends"

children.heading: With Verbs of Thinking/Knowing
children.content: 本当かどうか考えています "I'm thinking about whether it's true" できるか試してみます "I'll try to see if I can do it" 正しいかどうか確認してください "Please confirm whether it's correct"

children.heading: Kansai Dialect
children.content:
Often omits か even in polite speech:

Standard: 何ですか？ Kansai: 何ですか → 何です？ "What is it?"

children.heading: かい (kai) - Masculine/Old-fashioned
children.content:
元気かい？ "Are you well?" (masculine) わかるかい？ "Do you understand?" (masculine)

Used mainly by older men or in fiction.

children.heading: かしら (kashira) - Feminine/Old-fashioned
children.content:
本当かしら？ "I wonder if it's true?" (feminine) 来るかしら？ "I wonder if they'll come?" (feminine)

Less common in modern speech, sounds dated.

children.heading: かな (kana) - Wondering
children.content:
Gender-neutral, modern:

できるかな？ "I wonder if I can do it?" 本当かな？ "I wonder if it's true?" 誰かな？ "I wonder who it is?"

children.heading: かね (ka ne)
children.content:
Seeking agreement or confirmation:

高いですかね？ "It's expensive, isn't it?" 難しいですかね？ "It's difficult, isn't it?" そうですかね？ "Is that so?"

children.heading: かよ (ka yo)
children.content:
Expressing surprise or disbelief (casual/rough):

本当かよ！ "Really?!" (masculine) 嘘だろう？ "No way, right?"

children.heading: から (kara) after か
children.content:
Sometimes seen but redundant:

Less common: 行きますかから Standard: 行きますか "Will you go?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using か with だ in casual speech
children.content: Wrong: 学生だか？ ❌ Right: 学生？ ✓ (casual) Right: 学生ですか？ ✓ (polite)

children.heading: Mistake 2: Forgetting か in formal situations
children.content: Too casual: 何です (in formal setting) ⚠️ Better: 何ですか？ ✓ "What is it?"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Double か
children.content: Wrong: これは何ですかか？ ❌ Right: これは何ですか？ ✓ "What is this?"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using か after の casually
children.content: Sounds rough: 行くのか？ ⚠️ Better (casual): 行くの？ ✓ Polite: 行くのですか？ ✓

children.heading: In Writing
children.content:
か is almost always included in polite writing Question mark ？ is often added Formal documents always use か

ご参加いただけますか？ "Could you participate?" お名前を教えていただけますか？ "Could you tell me your name?"

children.heading: In Speaking
children.content:
Polite: Always use か Casual: Often omit か, use intonation Regional variations exist

Written/Formal: 行きますか？ Spoken polite: 行きますか？ Spoken casual: 行く？

children.heading: 〜か〜ないか (whether or not)
children.content: 行くか行かないか決めてください "Please decide whether to go or not" 好きか嫌いかはっきりして "Be clear about whether you like it or hate it"

children.heading: Multiple か in One Sentence
children.content: 誰が何をどこで買うか知っていますか？ "Do you know who will buy what where?" いつどこでどうやって会うか相談しましょう "Let's discuss when, where, and how to meet"

children.heading: か with Potential Form
children.content: できますか？ "Can you do it?" 読めますか？ "Can you read it?" 行けますか？ "Can you go?"

children.heading: Very Formal
children.content: 〜いただけますでしょうか？ "Could you possibly...?" 〜してくださいますか？ "Would you do...?"

children.heading: Standard Polite
children.content: 〜しますか？ "Will you...?" 〜ですか？ "Is it...?"

children.heading: Rough (avoid)
children.content: 〜するのか？ "Are you going to...?" 〜なのか？ "Is it...?"

children.heading: Basic Questions
children.content: これは何ですか？ "What is this?" どこに行きますか？ "Where are you going?" いつ来ますか？ "When will you come?" 誰ですか？ "Who is it?"

children.heading: Embedded Questions
children.content: 何時に始まるか知っていますか？ "Do you know what time it starts?" 誰が来るかわかりません "I don't know who is coming" どこにあるか教えてください "Please tell me where it is"

children.heading: かどうか Patterns
children.content: 本当かどうか確認します "I'll confirm whether it's true" できるかどうか試します "I'll try to see if I can do it" 来るかどうか聞いてみます "I'll try asking if they're coming"
